FuncDef:
The gvrp command enables GVRP on an interface.
The undo gvrp command disables GVRP on an interface.
By default, GVRP is disabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable GVRP, run the gvrp command in the system and interface views. After GVRP is enabled globally and on interfaces, a device can dynamically register or deregister VLANs on the GVRP interfaces.
Precautions
If the gvrp command is run in the system view, the command takes effect globally. If the gvrp command is run in an interface view, the command takes effect only on the interface.Before enabling GVRP on an interface, you must enable GVRP globally.GVRP applies only to trunk interfaces.
